title: Is Acupuncture Worth It for Your Recovery Routine? - Muscle & Fitness

description: People use acupuncture for seemingly everything these days, from chronic pain to anxiety. Can it help your exercise, too?

Talented stars, killer physiques. At age 62, "Big Bill" shares his wisdom to dominate one of the ultimate strength marks. Follow these fit women we're crushing on for inspiration, workout ideas, and motivation. From [Kobe Bryant](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/athletes-celebrities/news/kobe-bryant-closes-door-20-year-nba-career/) and [Draymond Green](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/athletes-celebrities/news/draymond-green-buys-20-blink-fitness-gyms-shouts-out-performance-inspired/) to [Aaron Trotter, it seems tons of [athletes](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/athletes-celebrities/news/athletes-under-25-who-will-make-you-feel-weak/) embrace acupuncture these days. Experts agree the [centuries-long Chinese technique](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/athletes-celebrities/news/life-and-workouts-martial-arts-legend-bruce-lee/)—which uses hair-thin needles inserted at set points to [rebalance our qi, or energy](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/features/edge/11-reasons-you-have-no-energy/)—can have a myriad of benefits. And now, high-performing athletes use it to [soothe muscle soreness](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/workouts/workout-tips/how-alleviate-delayed-onset-muscle-soreness/), [maintain health](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/life/10-lifestyle-changes-make-get-fitter-and-healthier/), and [boost their athletic performance](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/workouts/workout-tips/5-ways-yoga-can-boost-performance-athletes/), too. But is it worth bringing into your wellness regimen? For some, it might seem a superfluous expense, with the average [acupuncture session costing](https://thervo.com/costs/acupuncture-cost) $50 to $90 a session; Consumer Reports says that people spend $200 on average over the course of an entire treatment. Some insurances plans cover it, but it might seem a steep price for something that only might help. However, when viewed as a way to [optimize your overall health](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/nutrition/lose-fat/5-important-steps-optimize-your-metabolism/) routine in a [more holistic way](https://www.muscleandfitness.com/routine/holistic-training-explosive-growth/), acupuncture may help you uplevel your fitness to exciting new heights. We rounded up a few studies and spoke with [Dr. Kirsten Paynter](https://www.mayoclinic.org/biographies/paynter-kirsten-s-m-d/bio-20054539), consultant and assistant professor at the [Department of Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation at Mayo Clinic Arizona](https://www.mayoclinic.org/departments-centers/physical-medicine-rehabilitation-mayo-clinic/sections/overview/ovc-20467039), about acupuncture's benefits.
